channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Crater at edge of road, 29th January
item.description:
Looks like previous repair now a massive crater. Must be nearly a foot deep. On edge of road as head away from Cleeve - where there are two gates opposite each other What 3 Words: /// loaf.holly.drag
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Road verges are covered in litter, 29th January
item.description:
Hyde Lane is an absolutely eye sore with rubbish covering the verges and into the hedgerow. Swindon Parish council litter pick as far as we can on the paths but cannot continue on the road. It’s horrible driving into our parish now along a litter strewn road. Please can the council clear the verges of litter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boundary fence being moved, is council land being illegally taken?, 29th January
item.description:
The property on Kayte Lane just south of the football club is installing a new fence which is around 1m outside of their current one. I am concerned that this is not their land, and it will make it harder for pedestrians to walk along the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning needed, 28th January
item.description:
Churchill Drive from Haywards Rd passing in front of Churchill Gardens needs cleaning. A huge amount of leaves that have fallen over the last few years and not been swept up have now caused a complete and utter mess of the road and need clearing. According to your website leaf clearing is scheduled in 7 areas but not Churchill Drive, why not?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Churchill Drive, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The temporary lights have been placed 25 yards from a signalled road junction, cars are jumping the junction lights in order to go through the temporary lights when on green. Prioviously road works sround north upton labe gave resulted in 4 way lightc to includevthe Greenways traffic junction. This is now not the case, so when exiting Greenways on a green light cars are constantly having near misses with cars not stoppingat a red light on barnwood road. Wales and west refuse to accept there is a safety issue. The tempirary lights need to be moved to the junction of Greenways and have the main junction light tutned off to allow safe exit for Greenway residents, 28th January
item.description:
Barnwood construction, barnwood toad
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
